required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dexmedetomidine as a Rapid Bolus in Children for Emergence Agitation
clinical_study.official_title: Dexmedetomidine as a Rapid Bolus for Treatment and Prophylactic Prevention of Emergence Agitation in Anesthetized Children

collaborator.agency: Hospira, now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: To Determine The Efficacy of a Rapid Bolus Injection of Dexmedetomidine on the Incidence of Emergence Agitation in Anesthetized Children and the Cardiovascular Profile of a Rapid Bolus Injection of Dexmedetomidine.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Heart rate was measured immediately prior to study drug injection (baseline) and every minute thereafter for 5 minutes. Heart rate was also measured upon the patient's arrival to the Post-Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU).

Systolic blood pressure (SBP) was measured immediately prior to study drug injection (baseline) and every minute thereafter for 5 minutes. SBP was also measured upon the patient's arrival to the Post-Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU).
primary_outcome.description: mmHg Two subjects with missing data points for SBP were necessarily eliminated from repeated measures analysis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Diastolic blood pressure (DBP) was measured immediately prior to study drug injection (baseline) and every minute thereafter for 5 minutes. DBP was also measured upon the patient's arrival to the Post-Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU).
primary_outcome.description: mmHg Three subjects with missing data points for DBP were necessarily eliminated from repeated measures analysis.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The highest PAED score for each patient within the first 30 minutes after waking up was recorded.
secondary_outcome.description: Using a Pediatric Anesthesia Emergence Delirium (PAED) score, emergence agitation scores will be recorded. The PAED score consists of 5 different criteria which are assessed from 0 to 4 once the patient has woken up. These criteria are then totaled; the total may range from 0 to 20, where 0 represents no emergence agitation and 20 represents maximal agitation. For this study, patients with a maximum PAED score of >10 and >12 were considered to be agitated.

intervention.description: 0.5 micrograms/Kilogram one time bolus 5 minutes prior to the end of surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- children undergoing tonsillectomy with and without adenoidectomy and myringotomy and tube insertion
- ASA 1,2,3
- females who have started menses but have a negative urine pregnancy test
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with known dysrhythmias,
- not recovering in the ICU
- developmental delay,
- autism communication disorder
- bleeding disorder
- PI discretion

overall_official.affiliation: Children's Hospital of Pittsburgh of UPMC

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 418 patients overall were enrolled in the study. Of these patients, 18 failed screening prior to randomization into either treatment arm.

group.title: Dexmedetomidine
group.description: Dexmedetomidine Dexmedetomidine: 0.5 micrograms/Kilogram one time rapid bolus 5 minutes prior to the end of surgery

group.title: Dexmedetomidine
group.description: Dexmedetomidine Dexmedetomidine: 0.5 micrograms/Kilogram one time rapid bolus 5 minutes prior to the end of surgery Of the 200 patients in this treatment arm, 5 were totally excluded from analysis due to administration of medications that were not a part of the anesthetic protocol.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Normal saline equivalent volume Placebo Of the 200 patients in this treatment arm, 2 were totally excluded from analysis due to administration of medications that were not a part of the anesthetic protocol.

outcome.title: Heart Rate (HR)
outcome.time_frame: Heart rate was measured immediately prior to study drug injection (baseline) and every minute thereafter for 5 minutes. Heart rate was also measured upon the patient's arrival to the Post-Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU).
outcome.population: Heart rate values were compared between groups at each time point and within groups over time.

group.title: Dexmedetomidine
group.description: Dexmedetomidine Dexmedetomidine: 0.5 micrograms/Kilogram one time bolus 5 minutes prior to the end of surgery

measure.title: Heart Rate (HR)
measure.population: Heart rate values were compared between groups at each time point and within groups over time.

analysis.groups_desc: Heart rate values at each time point were compared between groups.
analysis.p_value_desc: P<0.01 for the following time points, 1 minute, 2 minutes, 3 minutes, 4 minutes, 5 minutes, and PACU. P-values are adjusted for multiple comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: Heart rate values were compared over time against the baseline value.
analysis.p_value_desc: P<0.01 for the following time points, as compared to the baseline value: 1 minute, 2 minutes, 3 minutes, 4 minutes, 5 minutes, and PACU. P-values are adjusted for multiple comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: Heart rate values were compared over time against the baseline value.
analysis.p_value_desc: P<0.01 for the following time points, as compared to the baseline value: 4 minutes, 5 minutes, and PACU. P-values are adjusted for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: Incidence of Emergence Agitation (EA)
outcome.description: Using a Pediatric Anesthesia Emergence Delirium (PAED) score, emergence agitation scores will be recorded. The PAED score consists of 5 different criteria which are assessed from 0 to 4 once the patient has woken up. These criteria are then totaled; the total may range from 0 to 20, where 0 represents no emergence agitation and 20 represents maximal agitation. For this study, patients with a maximum PAED score of >10 and >12 were considered to be agitated.
outcome.time_frame: The highest PAED score for each patient within the first 30 minutes after waking up was recorded.
outcome.population: There were 2 patients in the Dexmedetomidine group and 9 patients in the placebo group who were excluded from analysis of emergence agitation. These patients were excluded because they received medications that were not a part of the anesthetic protocol and could affect their PAED score.

group.title: Dexmedetomidine
group.description: Dexmedetomidine Dexmedetomidine: 0.5 micrograms/Kilogram one time rapid bolus 5 minutes prior to the end of surgery

measure.title: Incidence of Emergence Agitation (EA)
measure.description: Using a Pediatric Anesthesia Emergence Delirium (PAED) score, emergence agitation scores will be recorded. The PAED score consists of 5 different criteria which are assessed from 0 to 4 once the patient has woken up. These criteria are then totaled; the total may range from 0 to 20, where 0 represents no emergence agitation and 20 represents maximal agitation. For this study, patients with a maximum PAED score of >10 and >12 were considered to be agitated.
measure.population: There were 2 patients in the Dexmedetomidine group and 9 patients in the placebo group who were excluded from analysis of emergence agitation. These patients were excluded because they received medications that were not a part of the anesthetic protocol and could affect their PAED score.

analysis.groups_desc: The incidence of agitated patients in each group was compared.
analysis.p_value_desc: P<0.0001 was calculated for both groups.

outcome.title: Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP)
outcome.description: mmHg Two subjects with missing data points for SBP were necessarily eliminated from repeated measures analysis.
outcome.time_frame: Systolic blood pressure (SBP) was measured immediately prior to study drug injection (baseline) and every minute thereafter for 5 minutes. SBP was also measured upon the patient's arrival to the Post-Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU).
outcome.population: Systolic blood pressure values were compared between groups at each time point and within groups over time.

group.title: Dexmedetomidine
group.description: Dexmedetomidine Dexmedetomidine: 0.5 micrograms/Kilogram one time rapid bolus 5 minutes prior to the end of surgery

measure.title: Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP)
measure.description: mmHg Two subjects with missing data points for SBP were necessarily eliminated from repeated measures analysis.
measure.population: Systolic blood pressure values were compared between groups at each time point and within groups over time.

analysis.groups_desc: Systolic blood pressure values were compared between groups at each time point.
analysis.p_value_desc: P<0.01 for the following time points: 1 minute, 4 minutes, 5 minutes, and PACU. P-values are adjusted for multiple comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: SBP values were compared against the baseline value within each group over time.
analysis.p_value_desc: P<0.01 for the following time points, as compared to the baseline value: 1 minute, 3 minutes, 4 minutes, and 5 minutes. P-values are adjusted for multiple comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: SBP values were compared against the baseline within each group over time.
analysis.p_value_desc: P<0.01 for the following time points, as compared to the baseline value: 5 minutes and PACU. P-values were adjusted for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP)
outcome.description: mmHg Three subjects with missing data points for DBP were necessarily eliminated from repeated measures analysis.
outcome.time_frame: Diastolic blood pressure (DBP) was measured immediately prior to study drug injection (baseline) and every minute thereafter for 5 minutes. DBP was also measured upon the patient's arrival to the Post-Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU).
outcome.population: Diastolic blood pressure values were compared between groups at each time point and within groups over time.

group.title: Dexmedetomidine
group.description: Dexmedetomidine Dexmedetomidine: 0.5 micrograms/Kilogram one time rapid bolus 5 minutes prior to the end of surgery

measure.title: Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP)
measure.description: mmHg Three subjects with missing data points for DBP were necessarily eliminated from repeated measures analysis.
measure.population: Diastolic blood pressure values were compared between groups at each time point and within groups over time.

analysis.groups_desc: DBP values were compared between groups at each time point.
analysis.p_value_desc: P<0.01 for the following time points: 1 minute and PACU. P-values were adjusted for multiple comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: DBP values were compared within each group against the baseline value.
analysis.p_value_desc: P<0.01 for the following time points, as compared to baseline: 1 minute, 3 minutes, 4 minutes, 5 minutes, PACU. P-values were adjusted for multiple comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: DBP values were compared against the baseline value within each group over time.
analysis.p_value_desc: P<0.01 for the following time points, as compared to baseline: 4 minutes, 5 minutes, PACU. P-values were adjusted for multiple comparisons.

group.title: Dexmedetomidine
group.description: Dexmedetomidine Dexmedetomidine: 0.5 micrograms/Kilogram one time rapid bolus 5 minutes prior to the end of surgery

event.description: The serious adverse event (SAE) was associated with a prolonged hospital stay. The investigators felt the SAE was unrelated to the study drug.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: Children's Hospital of Pittsburgh of UPMC
